Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's assessment of fear of persecution based on religious practice
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found credible as a practicing Catholic
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence regarding religious practices in Fujian, China
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution for practicing Catholicism in China
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of evidence of personal risk despite general religious restrictions
Application_Factor: Personal credibility vs. country condition evidence
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board’s decision was reasonable
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of personal risk of persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of arrest warrant or targeted state action
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board's interpretation
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
